task.title: Manage Snapshots
task.shortdesc: This screen allows you to view a list of your snapshots, create new snapshots, and delete snapshots.

step.cmd: You can toggle between the table view and the grid view by clicking the appropriate icon next to the View label at the top right of the screen.
Sort the snapshots list by selecting a sort order using the Sort by drop-down list box.

task.title: Searching and Filtering the Volumes List

step.cmd: To perform a simple search/filter, type some search text into the search text box at the top right of the page.
For more precise filtering and searching, you can add one or more filters by clicking one of the availabile filters in the Filter by section on the right side of the page.
Click the Create New Snapshot button. The Create new snapshot dialog box will appear.

task.title: Viewing Details of a Snapshot
task.shortdesc: Several items in the snapshot list allow you to click on them to see more detailed information.

taskbody.context: To see more details about a snapshot, or an object associated with an image:

step.cmd: Click the name in the list of snapsots to display detailed information about the selected snapshot.
Click a volume ID to see to see detailed information about the volume associated with the selected snapshot.

task.title: Context menu actions
task.shortdesc: Each entry in the snapshots list has a context menu, accessible in the Actions column. Clicking the action icon brings up a menu of actions that you can perform on the selected snapshot.

taskbody.context: The following context menu actions are availabe:

step.cmd: This item will bring up the snapshot detail page.
This item brings up a page that allows you to create a volume from the selected snapshot.

This item allows you to register the selected snapshot as an image in your cloud, if it was created from a volume containing a root file system. The image can then be used to launch EBS-backed instances.
This item allows you to delete a snapshot.
